author: @newspaper
title: സൽമാൻഖാന് ഭീഷണിസന്ദേശം: യുവാവ് പിടിയിൽ
text:
മുംബൈ: ബോളിവുഡ് താരം സൽമാൻഖാന് ഭീഷണിസന്ദേശമയച്ച സംഭവത്തിൽ ജംഷഡ്പുരിൽനിന്നുള്ള പച്ചക്കറിക്കച്ചവടക്കാരൻ ഷെയ്ഖ് ഹുസൈൻ ഷെയ്ഖ് മൗസിൻ (24) പിടിയിലായി. കഴിഞ്ഞയാഴ്ച മുംബൈ ട്രാഫിക് പോലീസിന്റെ വാട്സാപ്പ് ഹെൽപ് ലൈനിലാണ് സന്ദേശം വന്നത്. അഞ്ചുകോടിരൂപ ആവശ്യപ്പെട്ടായിരുന്നു സന്ദേശം. ആവശ്യപ്പെട്ട തുക നൽകിയാൽ ലോറൻസ് ബിഷ്ണോയ് സംഘവുമായി രമ്യതയിലാക്കാമെന്നും അല്ലെങ്കിൽ ബാബാ സിദ്ദിഖിയുടെ അവസ്ഥയായിരിക്കുമെന്നുമായിരുന്നു സന്ദേശത്തിലുണ്ടായിരുന്നത്.
പോലീസ് അന്വേഷണമാരംഭിച്ചതിനുപിന്നാലെ ട്രാഫിക് പോലീസിന് ഇയാളിൽനിന്ന് മാപ്പപേക്ഷിച്ചുള്ള സന്ദേശവും ലഭിച്ചിരുന്നു. ലോറൻസ് ബിഷ്ണോയി സംഘത്തിൽനിന്ന് സൽമാൻഖാന് വധഭീഷണി നിലനിൽക്കുന്ന സഹചര്യത്തിൽ പോലീസ് അന്വേഷണം ശക്തമാക്കുകയായിരുന്നു.
Share this Article
Related Topics
RELATED STORIES
വാര്ത്തകളോടു പ്രതികരിക്കുന്നവര് അശ്ലീലവും അസഭ്യവും നിയമവിരുദ്ധവും അപകീര്ത്തികരവും സ്പര്ധ വളര്ത്തുന്നതുമായ പരാമര്ശങ്ങള് ഒഴിവാക്കുക. വ്യക്തിപരമായ അധിക്ഷേപങ്ങള് പാടില്ല. ഇത്തരം അഭിപ്രായങ്ങള് സൈബര് നിയമപ്രകാരം ശിക്ഷാര്ഹമാണ്. വായനക്കാരുടെ അഭിപ്രായങ്ങള് വായനക്കാരുടേതു മാത്രമാണ്, മാതൃഭൂമിയുടേതല്ല. ദയവായി മലയാളത്തിലോ ഇംഗ്ലീഷിലോ മാത്രം അഭിപ്രായം എഴുതുക. മംഗ്ലീഷ് ഒഴിവാക്കുക..

author: 三立新聞網
title: 【搭飛機禁忌】2025年最新「4大機上飲食地雷」　機師：誤踩害脫水胃痛 | 祝你健康 | 三立新聞網 HEALTH.SETN.COM
text:
記者鄭玉如／台北報導
▲2025年最新「4大機上飲食地雷」，例如避免過量喝酒及咖啡，以免引發脫水和腸胃不適。（圖／PIXABAY）
搭飛機時，由於身處高空環境，機艙內氣壓比地面低，容易影響腸胃功能，因此飲食方面須格外注意。達美航空副機師保羅‧雅諾維奇（Paul Janowicz）分享搭飛機4大飲食禁忌，包括過量飲酒和咖啡、飲用碳酸飲料、重口味飲食、味道太重的食物，都容易造成身體不適。
2025年最新【搭飛機4大飲食禁忌】
保羅‧雅諾維奇（Paul Janowicz）在《紐約郵報》（New York Post）表示，想在飛行期間保持舒適，特別要注意飲食，吃錯食物或喝錯飲料，都可能導致身體昏沉，甚至是脫水。
1. 過量飲酒和咖啡
喝酒會導致脫水，使人在飛行中感到昏沉、疲倦，另外，由於機艙內的壓力變化，高空喝酒比在地面上更快喝醉。而咖啡具有輕微的利尿作用，飛行環境較為乾燥，期間沒有補充水分，又一直喝咖啡，更容易感到口乾、頭痛、疲勞，甚至造成脫水。
2. 飲用碳酸飲料
碳酸飲料容易引起脹氣，搭飛機時最好別飲用，尤其是飛機爬升或下降時，機艙內壓力會產生變化。
3. 重口味飲食
登機前若食用辛辣食物，也容易造成腸胃不適，因此飛機餐通常設計得較為清淡，避免旅客在飛行中出現胃痛等不適症狀。另外，也應避免攝取鈉含量高的油炸食物，這類食物容易引起腹脹與脫水。
4. 味道太重的食物
吃味道太重的食物，不只容易造成腸胃不適，也會影響到其他乘客，例如魚罐頭。
▲2025年最新「4大機上飲食地雷」曝光，登機前避免吃辛辣食物，以免造成腸胃不適等問題。（圖／PIXABAY）
【3招搭飛機更舒適】穿對衣服、多補水，出遊不掃興
根據《Travel Sentry》官網顯示，搭飛機時最好選擇寬鬆舒適的衣服，或層次穿搭、帶輕薄的圍巾等，有助於適應不斷變化的機艙溫度，另外，飛行途中記得多補充水分，因為機艙環境乾燥，容易造成脫水，進而導致不適和疲勞，若是長途飛行，可能出現血液循環不良的狀況，建議可在座位上適度活動身體，例如抬腳、扭動腳踝等，有助於促進血液循環。
三立新聞網提醒您：
喝酒不開車、開車不喝酒！
未成年請勿飲酒，飲酒過量，有礙健康！

author: Eunice Masson
title: Chaos, violence on major Cape Town roads as taxis go on strike - The Mail & Guardian
text: National / 28 December 2023 By Eunice Masson FacebookXEmailLinkedInWhatsApp A metro police vehicle was set alight Traffic peaked early on major roads connecting Cape Town to surrounding suburbs on Thursday afternoon as dozens of minibus taxis left the inner city after the South African National Taxi Council (Santaco) announced a provincial shutdown that is set to last for seven days. Shortly after 3pm, slow-moving traffic was recorded on major routes due to taxis leaving the city. Soon after, incidents of public violence were reported which led to road closures on the N2, M5 and Jakes Gerwel Drive, the city’s traffic services spokesperson, Kevin Jacobs, confirmed. Footage shared widely on official traffic WhatsApp groups showed incidents of looting taking place between Duinefontein and Jakes Gerwel Drive, while a traffic service vehicle was set alight on the N2. In another incident, a bus was set alight at the Nyanga taxi rank. Renewed tension between the local government and the minibus taxi service started last week when Santaco withdrew its participation from the minibus taxi task team — an initiative aimed at addressing permit barriers and other grievances in the Western Cape. A meeting was convened between the taxi council, its executives and regional associations in response to the city’s enforcement operations earlier this week which resulted in 15 minibus taxis being impounded and saw several people arrested. A bus was torched at Nyanga taxi rank Santaco’s deputy chair Nceba Enge said all the taxis across the region were being “called” as he spoke to the Mail & Guardian. “We are hopeful that they [the local government] will feel the pain of the people that are out there without transport, now, as we speak,” said Enge, while sharing a video showing Mitchells Plain’s northern transport interchange empty as people gathered at the rank were left stranded. In a statement, Santaco said it had taken a decision to embark on a strike from 3pm on Thursday and resume services on 10 August. “This decision has not been taken lightly, but as an industry, we are left with no other option but to embark on this stayaway, due to the frivolous impoundment operations run by the government, which has had a negative impact on our operators and industry.” According to Santaco’s provincial spokesperson Mandla Hermanus, 6 000 taxis have been impounded since January. “During this stayaway there will be no march or any form of protests that will take place. All operations will stop and we have urged our operators to refrain from any acts of violence and threatening behaviour,” reads the statement. Tags: City Of Cape Town, news, South African National Taxi Council, Taxi Strike

author: Kylie Walker
title: chevron-right
text: MAURY COUNTY, Tenn. (WZTV) — In Maury County, where several [people were injured and one person died](https://fox17.com/news/local/radar-confirmed-tornado-hits-maury-county-wednesday-middle-tennessee-columbia-spring-hill-national-weather-service-severe-weather#), Columbia residents describe what they saw as a tornado ripped through their neighborhood. On Thursday, FOX 17 News went into some of the hardest hit communities seeing just some of the devastation, that families now have to grapple with. Some of the damage was seen on Cardinal Trail. It's the roadway where Shannon McCue rushed to in an attempt to get home to her husband, Adam Lazenby. ALSO READ | ['Come together, have patience and rebuild': Maury County community unites amid devastation](https://fox17.com/newsletter-daily/come-together-have-patience-and-rebuild-maury-county-community-unites-amid-deadly-tornado-devastation-severe-weather-columbia-spring-hill-tennessee) But the storm hit sooner than she expected, with two fallen trees trapping her car in. This, while Lazenby says he road out the tornado on their property. I was sitting in the driveway waiting for her to get home and then the back shop door blew into the hood of my truck and I ran and just jumped in the back seat as the tornado just took the whole shop around me," detailed Lazenby. "You did see it, you said it sounded like a freight train," said McCue. "It's cliché, but it really is that loud like a train. It took most the building with it. His truck and the debris is still there. The truck saved him." Celebrating their 10-year anniversary this year, this couple now feels closer than ever. And although they're now looking at upwards of $100,000 in damage, they are just thankful their home is still standing. As of Thursday, the Tennessee Emergency Management Agency says in Maury County 105 homes were damaged and 40 were destroyed. TEMA says they're working with the community to do a more formal damage assessment Friday morning at first light, and they'll be evaluating that damage to see what kind of potential aid these families may qualify for. Get reports like this and all the news of the day in Middle Tennessee delivered to your inbox each morning with the [FOX 17 News Daily Newsletter](https://fox17.com/sign-up).

author: ABC News
title: Mom born on Leap Day welcomes baby on Leap Day - ABC News
text: Mom born on Leap Day welcomes baby on Leap Day "I just hope that she knows that she's special." A North Carolina mother who was [born on Leap Day](https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/living/video/leap-day-babies-celebrate-birthdays-caribbean-cruise-107669261) 40 years ago welcomed a baby girl Thursday, which also happens to be Leap Day. Dr. Kai Sun, an assistant professor of medicine and a rheumatologist at Duke Health, and her husband, Michael Paik, welcomed their third child, a daughter they named Chloe at 5:12 a.m. on Feb. 29. Baby Chloe made her big debut three days after her Feb. 26 due date and weighed in at 6 pounds and 13 ounces, Sun said. "My husband and I were just saying how cool it would be if she were born on the same day as my birthday. And somehow, it happened," Sun told ["Good Morning America"](https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/) Thursday morning from her hospital bed at Duke University Hospital, where she also works. Sun said she and her daughter are now both "doing well." "She was breathing fast initially when she was born so they took her to the nursery for a little bit to see the pediatrician but everything checked out and she's peacefully sleeping," Sun said. Chloe's [Leap Day arrival](https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/news/video/sisters-share-leap-day-birthday-doctor-delivered-69297676) is a notable one, not just because of her birth date but also because she is a rainbow baby for Sun and Paik. "We had a [miscarriage](https://www.goodmorningamerica.com/wellness/story/miscarriage-stillbirth-nervous-65986881) almost exactly a year ago and so that makes her more special," Sun said. "There were some little things along the way," the doctor added of her pregnancy. "There was some abnormal finding on the initial ultrasound that we were nervous about. And then I had COVID. And I fell on my belly in [my] third trimester. There are just some small things that happened that made us a little nervous but everything turned out well at the end." Sun said she had a message for her newborn. "I just hope that she knows that she's special, not just because she has a special birthday," the mom of three said. For her birthday this year, Sun said she plans on resting but she hopes to be discharged Friday along with Chloe. She said she is also looking forward to introducing Chloe to her older siblings, Charis, 5, and Caleb, 3, and celebrating more in the days to come. "I look forward to taking her home with me and have her meet the rest of the family, my parents and her siblings," Sun said. "And we'll have cake, of course."

author: 自由時報電子報
title: 台電「大甲溪光明計畫」擬擴大 環團憂影響生態
text:
台電「大甲溪光明計畫」擬擴大 環團憂影響生態
台電大甲溪光明計畫，將利用德基水庫與谷關水庫水位落差發電。（議員古秀英提供）
〔記者歐素美／台中報導〕台電「大甲溪光明抽蓄水力計畫」，利用德基及谷關水庫水位落差，設置抽蓄水力發電機組，環保團體質疑有環評委員竟建議大甲溪光明電廠擴大規模；市議員古秀英表示，該計畫恐影響台灣黑熊等野生動植物生態，更影響部落族人生活，要求相關資訊一定要公開；台電指出，該計畫不建大壩，對環境影響較小。
台電重啟「大甲溪光明抽蓄水力計畫」，要打造全台第三座大型儲能設施，反雪谷纜車環保團體質疑環評時竟有委員建議評估擴大開發規模的可行性。
環團指出，該計畫鄰近台灣黑熊活動熱區，將在德基水庫、谷關水庫之間打通十．七公里的頭水隧道，涉及地質敏感區與開發面積大，且進出水口、地下廠房、土石堆置場等建設，都可能衝擊保育類及珍稀動植物，並質疑該計畫經費從二百億元暴增至六百億元，是否符合成本效益？
市議員古秀英表示，該計畫開挖路段和時間長，一定會影響族人生活，要求台電謹慎評估，不能犧牲部落小族群者的權利，需做到基本的尊重和告知，並重視對生態的影響。
台電表示，光明計畫因環評委員建議評估擴大規模的可行性，才調整抽蓄水力機組總裝置容量達六十一萬瓩，透過離峰時將下池水抽至上池儲能、尖峰時將上池水放至下池，達到儲能效果，並提出環境友善規劃，如遇稀有植物將優先採取施工迴避、原地保留等措施，努力降低對環境的影響。

author: Claire Hyland
title: Phoebe Tomlinson Pays Tribute To Late Mum With Baby's Name
text:
One Direction star Louis Tomlinson's 19-year-old sister Phoebe has become a mother after welcoming a baby girl with her partner Jack Varley.
In a beautiful reel, Phoebe, an influencer with over a million followers, shared the heartwarming moment her little girl came into the world.
Today's top videos
The clip which was shot in black and white skipped through her water birth with intimate scenes from her labour. At one point the camera pans out to a shot of a baby romper hanging in the room before quickly jumping to the moment when Phoebe tearfully cradled her baby for the first time.
Louis Tomlinson's sister has become a mum after welcoming a baby girl. Pic: Phoebe Tomlinson Instagram As the little girl was handed to her, Barton Town footballer Jack, whom she began dating in 2022, leaned in for a sweet kiss.
Cue more adorable shots of the baby wrapped up in a little hat and boots squirming about in her incubator and their little home movie ends with Phoebe crying as holds her.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by PHOEBE ROSE TOMLINSON (@thephoebetomlinson)
As well as the intimate video, Phoebe also shared her daughter's beautiful name which pays tribute to her late mother. She and Jack have named the little girl Olive, which is associated with peace, while her middle name is Johannah after Phoebe and Louis' late mum.
Johannah passed away at just 43 years of age in 2016 from leukemia and it looks like her memory will live on her granddaughter. The family also tragically lost their sister Félicité in 2019 who passed away from an accidental overdose.
Phoebe Tomlinson and her boyfriend Jack. Pic: Phoebe Tomlinson / Instagram According to Phoebe, Olive was a very healthy 7lb 7oz when she was born and congratulations have been pouring in from her family and legions of followers. Her dad Mark wrote: 'Way, way beyond proud, so begins the best journey in life ever.'
'Congratulations Phoebe, she's scrumptious and I love the name and its significance to you too. Enjoy these precious moments,' posted someone else.
View this post on Instagram A post shared by PHOEBE ROSE TOMLINSON (@thephoebetomlinson)
When the couple announced they were expecting in June they had thought they were having a baby boy but found out at their 20-week scan that they were actually having a girl. Phoebe said in August: 'After a few days of processing it, we’re ready to tell you all that at our 20-week scan we found out you’re a little girl, we’re so excited to meet you.'
Congratulations, Phoebe and Jack!

author: CNN Newsource
title: California beachgoers enthralled by huge waves from storms – but they bring flooding and rip currents too
text:
California beachgoers enthralled by huge waves from storms – but they bring flooding and rip currents too
By Cindy Von Quednow, David Williams and Robert Shackelford, CNN
(CNN) — Offshore storms shoved waves toward communities along the California coast, bringing flooding, evacuations and fright to nearly 20 people who were briefly swept away on a Ventura beach on Thursday.
The swells will not be a one-day thing: Some areas of the California coast will see towering waves – some up to 25 or 30 feet – through the weekend. The waves will usher high water and rip currents. Coastal flood alerts and high-surf alerts stretch from the US-Mexico border to north of the Bay Area.
Waves, coupled with high tides, sent torrents of seawater into Santa Cruz along the central coast.
The Santa Cruz County Sheriff’s Office issued an evacuation warning for some areas. The evacuation warning covered an unincorporated area of the county near Seacliff State Beach and Rio Del Mar, according to a
post on the department’s Facebook page.
California Highway Patrol Santa Cruz warned of coastal flooding at the Rio Del Mar Esplanade
in a post on X and urged people to avoid the area.
“Rio Del Mar Esplanade is currently flooded. Please avoid the area and do not attempt to drive across flooded areas. Road closures are in effect, so please do not drive around them. Drive with caution and prioritize safety,” it wrote.
Five campers were evacuated along the San Luis Obispo coast Thursday, officials detailed in a social media post.
The spectacular waves drew surfers and onlookers, who gawked at nature’s power.
Just northwest of Los Angeles, 15 to 20 onlookers were briefly swept away after a large wave overtook a beach barrier in a Ventura neighborhood hit by high surf, police Cmdr. Ryan Weeks told CNN.
The onlookers were washed down the street about 30 to 50 yards, Weeks said.
“No one was injured, but they were taken for a little ride,” he said.
Streets in the area were closed as a precaution, as was a main access point to the Ventura Pier to encourage people to stay away.
“We’re trying to keep people off the beach to keep them from getting hit by rogue waves,” Weeks said.
Aerial video from CNN affiliate
KABC showed the aftermath, as residents in the area tried to clean up the foamy, sandy mess.
The flooding comes as the Southern California coast was being impacted by large swells, the National Weather Service (NWS) in Los Angeles
said in a social media post.
One swell reached about 20 feet at Ventura Pier, the agency added.
“Dangerous surf, life-threatening rip currents, and coastal flooding are expected at the beaches this week. Impacts are expected to become most extreme on Thursday,” NWS in Los Angeles
posted.
The most significant impacts are expected along the central and Ventura County coasts, along with Hermosa, Manhattan and Palos Verdes beaches, according to the agency.
Fifteen to 20-foot waves are expected in the central coast, bringing potentially damaging coastal flooding.
“Beach conditions becoming extremely dangerous Thursday morning continuing through the weekend,” the NWS in Los Angeles said in its
forecast.
Officials recommend beachgoers stay out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions and potentially life-threatening rip currents. Beach erosion also is possible.
“Prepare for significant sea water flooding, especially in low-lying areas (including beaches/harbors) & at high tide,” the NWS in Los Angeles said.
In Ocean Beach, near San Diego, the curious and surfers thronged to the beach to take it all in, according to
CNN affiliate KGTV.
Not everyone who brought a board got into the roiling surf.
“My friend asked me if I wanted to come check it out, and once I saw it, I knew it was too large and in charge for me,” Gerry Giuliano told the affiliate. “I mean, it’s hitting the pier and that’s a warning sign that it’s pretty big, closing out and breaking pretty quickly, too.”
Northern California is expected to have its own share of problems.
The Bay Area is under a coastal flood warning until 6 p.m. Thursday, with significant coastal flooding expected through the evening hours before conditions begin to improve.
A high-surf warning is in effect in the Bay Area until 3 a.m. Friday.
“Dangerously large breaking waves of 28 to 33 ft with up to 40 ft possible at favored locations,” the NWS said.
The agency listed said San Francisco, Monterey Bay, Point Reyes and Big Sur are among the affected areas.
An
evacuation order was issued for a portion of Marin County near San Francisco.
A deadly storm
slammed the California coast in January 2023.
The-CNN-Wire
™ & © 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.
